oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Masque of Flowers: Gray's Inn
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Performance
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Whether this masque was performed in Gray’s Inn Hall is unknown. It was certainly presented at the ‘old’ Banqueting House, Whitehall, and financed (but not written) by Sir Francis Bacon. The Masque of Flowers was performed 6 January (Twelfth Night) 1613/14, entered in the Stationers’ Register on 21 January, and published soon thereafter. Music for the masque is printed on sigs C4v–E2 (see Inns of Court Volume 2, Appendix 12, p 783).
